speaker: Agent
text: So, the singularity is when technology advances faster than we can measure, predict, or even... understand, right?

speaker: Customer
text: Exactly. It's like math, but the numbers are riding jetpacks and flipping you off as they vanish into another dimension.

speaker: Agent
text: Wait, so you’re telling me our smartest equations just look at singularity math and go, 'Nah, bro, I’m out'?

speaker: Customer
text: Pretty much. It’s like asking a squirrel to file your taxes — technically possible, but deeply illegal and wildly inaccurate.

speaker: Agent
text: And we’re supposed to trust that somehow we’ll *merge* with these math-jetpack-squirrel-taxes and *become gods*?

speaker: Customer
text: Yep. Humanity’s endgame is apparently screaming 'YEEHAW!' while clinging to the back of a flaming abacus.
